q: How to find duplicate descriptions across multiple item codes, combining their quantities, and eliminating any unnecessary codes?
answer:
You can use the following query:
SELECT description, COUNT(*) as count FROM sfitem GROUP BY description HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

Go to Operations > System Maintenance > Change item code.
Input the item that you want to remove in the From field and the item that you want to keep in the To field. Than Press Save
This operation will merge qty and will delete unnecessary item.
If the item has an initial quantity, it will not be deleted, but rather marked as inactive, thereby fulfilling the condition for its non-deletion.
notes: This query will group the items in the table by their descriptions and count how many items share the same description. It will then filter the results to only show descriptions that appear more than once (i.e., duplicates). The output will include the description and the count of how many times it appears in the table.

q: What is the process for updating the invoice/ voucher rate from 1,515 to a new rate?
answer:
First do backup: go to End of session > backup.
You can use the following query to select:
select * from sftran inner join curtra on sftran.date=curtra.date and sftran.currcode=curtra.currcode where typecode='CA' and opercode='60' and month(sftran.date) >= 2 and year(sftran.date) = 2023

Than use the following query to update:
update sftran set ratelc=curtra.ratelc, ratebc=curtra.ratebc from sftran inner join curtra on sftran.date=curtra.date and sftran.currcode=curtra.currcode where typecode='CA' and opercode='60' and month(sftran.date) >= 2 and year(sftran.date) = 2023
Navigate to the invoice and click on Refresh to verify that the updated rates are functional.

Now for the voucher use the following query:
UPDATE afvouc SET ratelc = curtra.ratelc,ratebc = curtra.ratebc,amtlc = amtfc * curtra.ratelc,amtbc = amtfc / curtra.ratebc FROM afvouc INNER JOIN curtra ON afvouc.due = curtra.date AND afvouc.currcode = curtra.currcode INNER JOIN sftran ON sftran.uid = afvouc.uid WHERE sftran.opercode = '85' AND Month(afvouc.due) >= 2 AND Year(afvouc.due) = 2023
Navigate to the voucher and click on Refresh to verify that the updated rates are functional.

Proceed to Operations > System Maintenance > Fix and select Vouchers. Input the starting date for the fix (in this case, 01/02/2023) in the From field and specify a type in the Operation Type field (e.g., CA). Finally, click on Save.
Than go operations > accounting > system maintenance > fix > select Yes.

Than run this query to update the tottvalc column in the sftran table
update sftran set tottvalc = cast (ratelc * tottva as decimal(18,2)) where currcode <> '01'
notes: This SQL query updates the ratelc and ratebc columns in the sftran table with the corresponding values from the curtra table, based on certain conditions using an inner join. The update is performed only on rows where typecode is 'CA', date is in or after February 2023.

q: How to Fix Printer Spooler Errors in Windows?
answer: If you come across the Printer Spooler Problem error message, you can resolve it by restarting the print spooler using the following steps:
Either press the Windows key on your keyboard or click/tap inside the Search box and type the word services. Then, press Enter when you see the Services search result, or click or tap on it.
Go down the list of services arranged alphabetically and select Print Spooler. Click Restart.
notes: The Print Spooler is responsible for common printing errors on Windows by organizing data and sending it to low memory peripheral devices such as printers. When the Print Spooler fails, print jobs can get stuck in the queue, and the print data won't reach the printer. Resetting the spooler can solve these problems, canceling the print job and allowing a fresh start.

3. For the first quarter, input 31/03/2023 in the date field and specify First quarter in the details field.

q: How to export transactions dated 2024, which were mistakenly recorded in the company year 2023, and then import them into the company year 2024?
answer: This is an example of a 2024 transaction mistakenly recorded in 2023, which will make the 2024 opening balance incorrect. To fix this, delete the invoice from 2023, perform 'Closing End Of Year', and recreate it in 2024. If multiple invoices are affected, follow the steps in the next section.
Log in to Company Year 2023, then navigate to System > Synchronize > Export.

On the Export screen, enter the date range 01/01/2024 to 31/12/2024. Check only Purchases, Sales, Inventory, and Accounting. Click Browse to specify the export path, then click Export and wait for the process to finish.
Now Log in to Company Year 2024, then navigate to System > Synchronize > Import.
On the import screen, select the 'ReNumber' checkbox. Click Browse to choose the path for the previously exported transactions, then click Import and wait for the process to finish.

After completing the import, proceed to delete those transactions mistakenly recorded in company year 2023. Remember to always create a backup as a precaution. You can now perform the 'Closing End Of Year' process and verify that the opening balance in 2024 should now be correct.

To prevent users from making the same mistake, navigate to Company Year 2023 > System > Passwords > Users List. Enter 31/12/2023 in the Lock Date Field and click the 'Set All Lockdates' button. This action will restrict users from creating transactions for the year 2024 in the wrong year.
notes: Please note that when creating the exported file, you should not name it 'Exported', as it will not be imported due to the name. Instead, use a different name, such as '1xported', as shown in the previous example screenshots.
